intro: Oionychion pedatum var. ampliatum, commonly known as the broad-leaved oionychion, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, broad, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
